title: Roy Keane silences Sky Sports studio after heated Graeme Souness and Gary Neville argument

Roy Keane silenced the Sky Sports studio with his easy fix to Manchester United's goalscoring problems.

Gary Neville was engaged in a heated debate with Graeme Souness over Ole Gunnar Solskjaer's decision to offload Romelu Lukaku in the summer.

"[Mason] Greenwood at 17? That's how desperate Man United are," said Sounnes. "Go and get goalscorers who will win you games."

Neville interrupted: "He had a goalscorer in Lukaku - he's a proven goalscorer at the highest level - he didn't want him."

To which Souness replied: "So that's been a smart decision to start the season without a replacement for him, wasn't it? Gary, it's Man United!"

(Image: SkySports)

Neville hit back: "That's fine, but you're saying just get anyone in." To which Souness responded: "I'm saying a goalscorer, I'm not just saying anybody."

Listening to the debate, Keane decided to pipe up at this point with a simple solution to the problem: "Go and get [Harry] Kane."

His words captured the attention of the room, and everyone turned around to face him.

(Image: SkySports)

He continued: "Just go and get Kane from Spurs, easy. " He'll score 20 goals a season with his eyes shut. They're in disarray, so go and get him."

His comment, specifically the "what are you all staring at?" line sparked laughter from the room before Souness concluded: "Yes, get the best, that's what they always have done."
description: Gary Neville was engaged in a debate with Graeme Souness over Man United's decision to offload Romelu Lukaku
